H0.text: Aquifers recharge slowly is the best explanation for why population growth can result in water shortages and rationing in certain areas.

H1.text: Lake water is reserved for recreation, which explains why population growth can result in water shortages and rationing in certain areas.

H2.text: Increasing biomass decreases evaporation rates, which best explains why population growth can result in water shortages and rationing in certain areas.

H3.text: Tall buildings impede the development of rain clouds, which explains why population growth can result in water shortages and rationing in certain areas.

A4.text: Annual recharge, in the more arid parts of the aquifer, is estimated to total only about 10 percent of annual withdrawals.

A5.text: Groundwater depletion also adversely impacts the long‑term sustainability of groundwater supplies to help meet the Nation’s water needs.
